messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Admin/CommentController.php`, I found that `CommentController` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Full request paths created for the Admin Comment resource (as registered in routes/admin.php and used by the controller's redirects):

- GET /admin/comments
  - Controller: CommentController@index
  - Purpose: list (index)

- GET /admin/comments/{comment}/edit
  - Controller: CommentController@edit
  - Purpose: show edit form

- PUT /admin/comments/{comment}
  - Controller: CommentController@update
  - Purpose: update resource

- PATCH /admin/comments/{comment}
  - Controller: CommentController@update
  - Purpose: update resource (partial)

- DELETE /admin/comments/{comment}
  - Controller: CommentController@destroy
  - Purpose: delete resource

Methods acceptance (based on the code and routes shown):

- all HTTP methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
  - Reason: No explicit HEAD route is declared in routes/admin.php and no controller method for HEAD exists. (Do not assume framework automatic HEAD handling.)
- POST: false
  - Reason: Resource routes were limited with ->only(['index','edit','update','destroy']) so there is no create/store route (no POST).
- OPTIONS: false
  - Reason: No explicit OPTIONS route is declared.
- TRACE: false
  - Reason: No explicit TRACE route is declared.
- GET: true
  - Reason: index and edit are explicitly registered (GET /admin/comments and GET /admin/comments/{comment}/edit).
- PUT: true
  - Reason: update is registered (PUT /admin/comments/{comment}).
- DELETE: true
  - Reason: destroy is registered (DELETE /admin/comments/{comment}).
- PATCH: true
  - Reason: resource update routes include PATCH (PATCH /admin/comments/{comment}).

Explanation / evidence:
- routes/admin.php contains Route::resource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['index','edit','update','destroy']) which generates the listed routes for the comments resource.
- The controller implements index, edit, update, and destroy, matching those resource actions.
- The controller code uses named routes like route('admin.comments.edit', $comment) and route('admin.comments.index'), which implies the admin routes are registered under the "admin" name/URL grouping; thus I included the /admin prefix in the full paths.
